posts.content: Hi , I need a temporary garage, has anyone used one or know of them ?,Clarke make one. thanks for looking ....doug

I suppose it depends how long you need it for. The tarpaulin cover doesn't look like it'd last long on the ones I looked at on a google search. Are you talking weeks, months or years? I have a customer who got one made by a local marquee supplier, not sure of the cost but 10 years later its as good as new

I had one from Costco for a number of years. Lasted pretty well, eventually the UV rotted the material. My neighbour had one too, and that died much quicker as his was in a windy spot and the fabric suffered.

I used a race shelter from these guys http://www.surfturf.co.uk/shelters.htm I think it was the heavy duty one 2.5 x 5m to restore my bug in. lasted well, about 3 years exposed to all elements, welding inside, grinding etc, eventually the UV, wind, weight of snow etc destroyed the roof canopy.
thanks for the time to reply , I need one for a year or more ,I wondered if you get a lot condensation?..doug
Hi Doug, didn't get much condensation with the Race Shelter

Nick-Rackham wrote:
I used a race shelter from these guys http://www.surfturf.co.uk/shelters.htm I think it was the heavy duty one 2.5 x 5m to restore my bug in. lasted well, about 3 years exposed to all elements, welding inside, grinding etc, eventually the UV, wind, weight of snow etc destroyed the roof canopy.


Those race shelters look amazing! May get one for camping
If anyone wants to put their own fabric on a frame, I'm thinking of getting rid of poles.
